headline: Ancient Egypt linked to Milky Way in new scientific discovery - World News - LADbible
context: A new scientific study has revealed a direct symbolic connection between ancient Egyptian beliefs and the Milky Way galaxy, offering fresh insight into how early civilizations viewed the cosmos.
The findings highlight star imagery carved into Egyptian coffins, suggesting the Milky Way played a central role in their religious worldview.

annotations.paragraph: Researchers analysed wooden coffins dating back over 3,000 years, primarily from the Middle Kingdom period of Egypt (around 2055 to 1650 BCE).
annotations.reason: Provides specific details about the time period and artifacts studied.

annotations.paragraph: These coffins feature intricate carvings and paintings of stars on their interiors. While star motifs have long been recognised in Egyptian art, this new study is the first to connect them directly to the structure of the Milky Way.
annotations.reason: Explains the significance of the study's findings in relation to Egyptian art.

annotations.paragraph: The team, led by Dr. Rita Lucarelli, a renowned Egyptologist from the University of California, Berkeley, used 3D scanning technology and astronomical software to compare the coffin star maps with the real position of stars in the sky.
